00029 void usage()
00030 {
00031   fprintf(stderr,"usage: device_driver input_queue_size output_queue_size\n");

00033 
00034 int ReceiveNextPacket()
00035 {
00036   RawEthernetPacket packet;
00037   int rc;
00038 
00039   DEBUGPRINTF(5,"ReceiveNextPacket\n");
00040   if (EthernetGetNextPacket(&myconfig,&packet)<0) {
00041     fprintf(stderr,"Can't get next packet!\n");
00042     return -1;
00043   }
00044 #if DEBUG_RECV
00045   cerr << "device: received packet :" << packet<<"\n";
00046 #endif
00047   rc=input_queue->PushPacket(&packet);
00048   switch (rc) {
00049   case PACKETBUFFER_OK:
00050     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Pushed packet into input queue\n");
00051     break;
00052   case PACKETBUFFER_FULL:
00053     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Packet discarded - input queue is full\n");
00054     break;
00055   default:
00056     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Unknown packet_buffer error\n");
00057     break;
00058   }
00059   return 0;
00060 }
00061 
00062 int SendNextPacket()
00063 {
00064   RawEthernetPacket packet;
00065   int rc;
00066 
00067   DEBUGPRINTF(5,"SendNextPacket\n");
00068   rc=output_queue->PullPacket(&packet);
00069   switch (rc) {
00070   case PACKETBUFFER_OK:
00071     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Initsending next outgoing packet\n");
00072 #if DEBUG_SEND
00073     cerr << "device: sending packet :" << packet <<"\n";
00074 #endif
00075     if (EthernetInitiateSend(&myconfig,&packet)!=0) {
00076       DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Initsend failed: packet dropped\n");
00077       cerr << "device_driver: send failed\n";
00078     }
00079     break;
00080   case PACKETBUFFER_EMPTY:
00081     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"No outgoing packets remain\n");
00082       break;
00083   default:
00084     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Unknown packet_buffer error\n");
00085     break;
00086   }
00087   return 0;
00088 }

00090 
00091 int MyISR(int device, int service)
00092 {
00093   assert(device==myconfig.device);
00094 
00095   switch (service) {
00096   case ETHERNET_SERVICE_PACKET_READY:
00097     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"New packet available\n");
00098     return ReceiveNextPacket();
00099     break;
00100   case ETHERNET_SERVICE_OUTPUT_BUFFER_FULL:
00101     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Ethernet output buffer full, packet dropped\n");
00102     return 0;
00103     break;
00104   case ETHERNET_SERVICE_DMA_DONE:
00105     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Outgoing DMA done\n");
00106     return SendNextPacket();
00107     break;
00108   case ETHERNET_SERVICE_DMA_FAIL:
00109     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Outgoing DMA FAILED - packet dropped\n");
00110     return SendNextPacket();
00111     break;
00112   default:
00113     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Unknown service request\n");
00114     return -1;
00115     break;
00116   }
00117   return 0;
00118 }
00119 
00120 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00121 {
00122   int rc;
00123   int input_queue_size, output_queue_size;
00124 
00125   int muxin, muxout;
00126 
00127   fd_set input, output;
00128   sigset_t sigset;
00129 
00130   RawEthernetPacket packet;
00131 
00132   if (argc!=3) {
00133     usage();
00134     exit(-1);
00135   }
00136 
00137   input_queue_size=atoi(argv[1]);
00138   output_queue_size=atoi(argv[2]);
00139 
00140   input_queue=new RawEthernetPacketBuffer(input_queue_size);
00141   output_queue= new RawEthernetPacketBuffer(output_queue_size);
00142 
00143   if (input_queue==NULL || output_queue==NULL) {
00144     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"ISR: Can't allocate memory for queues\n");
00145     exit(-1);
00146   }
00147 
00148   muxout = open(ether2mux_fifo_name,O_WRONLY);
00149   muxin = open(mux2ether_fifo_name,O_RDONLY);
00150 
00151   EthernetStartup(&myconfig);
00152 
00153 
00154   cerr << "device_driver operating\n";
00155 
00156   int maxfd=0;
00157 
00158   while (1) {
00159     FD_ZERO(&input);
00160     FD_ZERO(&output);
00161     FD_SET(muxin,&input); maxfd=muxin;
00162     if (input_queue->Numitems()>0) {
00163       FD_SET(muxout,&output); maxfd=MAX(maxfd,muxout);
00164     }
00165     rc = select(maxfd+1,&input,&output,0,0);
00166 
00167     DEBUGPRINTF(5,"select done rc=%d\n",rc);
00168 
00169     if (rc<0) {
00170       if (errno==EINTR) {
00171         continue;
00172       } else {
00173         DEBUGPRINTF(5,"Unexpected error in select\n");
00174         exit(-1);
00175       }
00176     } else if (rc==0) {
00177       DEBUGPRINTF(5, "Unexpected timeout in select\n");
00178       exit(-1);
00179     } else if (rc>0) {
00180       DEBUGPRINTF(5,"some fds are available...\n",rc);
00181       sigemptyset(&sigset);
00182       sigaddset(&sigset,ETHERNET_SIGNAL);
00183       sigprocmask(SIG_BLOCK,&sigset,0);
00184       /* OK, now we are in critical section */
00185       if (FD_ISSET(muxout,&output)) {
00186         DEBUGPRINTF(5,"ISR about to output next packet to mux\n");
00187         /* we can output the next packet now, if there is one */
00188         if (input_queue->PullPacket(&packet)==PACKETBUFFER_OK) {
00189           packet.Serialize(muxout);
00190 #if DEBUG_RECV
00191           cerr << "New input packet: "<<packet<<"\n";
00192 #endif
00193         } else {
00194           DEBUGPRINTF(5,"No packets available, so ISR did not output one\n");
00195         }
00196       }
00197       if (FD_ISSET(muxin,&input)) {
00198         DEBUGPRINTF(3,"ISR about to input next packet from mux\n");
00199         /* we can input the next packet now */
00200         packet.Unserialize(muxin);
00201 #if DEBUG_SEND
00202         cerr << "New output packet: "<<packet<<"\n";
00203 #endif
00204         if (output_queue->PushPacket(&packet)!=PACKETBUFFER_OK) {
00205           DEBUGPRINTF(3,"Ouput queue full, packet dropped\n");
00206         }
00207         /* Now see if we have to start up the packet send */
00208         if (output_queue->Numitems()>0) {
00209           SendNextPacket();
00210         }
00211       }
00212       /* finish critical section */
00213       sigprocmask(SIG_UNBLOCK,&sigset,0);
00214     }
00215   }
00216   return 0;
00217 }
